comments.content:
It's in the official Comptia Material.
The Critical Chain Method
The critical chain method is a schedule network analysis method that allows you to consider
resource limitations and adjust the schedule as appropriate to work within those limitations. The
critical chain is established by analyzing the critical path alongside the resources that are actually
available. The critical chain method is also used to plan and manage reserves or buffers and helps
mitigate possible cost and schedule risks.

questions.question_text:
The project manager for a TV tower construction project receives notification that a strong storm is expected the following week.
Which of the following should the project manager do NEXT?
questions.answer_description: Reference: Kim Heldman, CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 2nd Edition, Sybex, Indianapolis, 2017, p. 238

discussion.content: Why wouldn't it be A? Wouldn't you want to inform stakeholders and put in an emergency change request?

comments.content:
Always develop a plan of action first, before making changes or notifying stakeholders. Remember - stakeholders want you to come with them with the problem AND the solution, not just the problem. Their time is valuable. 

The answer is 
C. Evaluate the risk, develop a mitigation plan, and communicate it according to the communication plan.

The communication plan will include contacting stakeholders. AFTER the plan of action is in place, of course.
